newsitem.title: UK: Moorfield buys UK property for 22.13 mln stg.
newsitem.headline: Moorfield buys UK property for 22.13 mln stg.

text.p: British property group Moorfield Estates Plc said on Monday it had agreed to buy a portfolio of UK properties from Imry Holdings for 22.13 million stg, through a joint venture with the real estate funds advised by Blackstone.
The portfolio comprises eight properties, including two central London office and retail buildings and a development site in Maidenhead, west of London.
Under the terms of the joint venture, Blackstone will provide an equity contribution of six million stg and Moorfield two million stg with the remaining sum coming from debt finance.
"The properties we have acquired are principally offices, by value, and offer potential for both income and capital uplift," said Moorfield's managing director Marc Gilbard.
"It is our intention to trade out the majority of the properties once values have been maximised."
